briefTitle: Effect of Fluoride in a Dentifrice on Remineralization of Erosive Lesions

armGroups.label: No fluoride dentifrice
interventionNames: Drug: no added fluoride in a silica base

interventions.name: no added fluoride in a silica base

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* intact maxillary dental arch suitable to retain a palatal appliance, an intact mandibular dental arch and a stimulated/unstimulated saliva flow rate of ≥ 0.8 milliliter/minute (ml/min) and ≥ 0.2 ml/min respectively.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage Surface Microhardness Recovery (%SMHR) Dose Response Relationship
outcomeMeasures.description: SMHR test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMHR was determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents rehardening of enamel surface. Percent SMHR was calculated from indentation values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), after in-situ hardening (R) and after first erosive challenge (E1) using formula: \[(E1-R)/ (E1-B)\]\*100.

outcomeMeasures.title: %SMHR
outcomeMeasures.description: SMHR test was used to assess the changes in mineralization status of enamel specimens using a Wilson 2100 Hardness tester. SMHR was determined by measuring the length of the indentations of enamel specimens. An increase in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates softening while decrease in the indentation length represents rehardening of enamel surface. Percent SMHR was calculated from indentation values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), after in-situ hardening (R) and after first erosive challenge (E1) using formula: \[(E1-R)/ (E1-B)\]\*100.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage Relative Erosion Resistance
outcomeMeasures.description: Changes in mineral content of enamel specimens exposed to dietary erosive challenge were determined by measuring the length of the indentations. Decrease in the indentation length compared to the baseline indicates hardening of enamel surface. Enamel specimens were exposed to second erosion challenge to determine relative erosion resistance which compared the indentations values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), first erosive (E1) and second erosive challenge (E2). Percent relative erosion resistance was calculated by formula: \[(E1-E2)/ (E1-B)\]\*100.

outcomeMeasures.title: Enamel Fluoride Uptake (Corrected Data)
outcomeMeasures.description: Enamel fluoride uptake was determined using the microdrill enamel biopsy technique. The amount of fluoride uptake by enamel was calculated based on amount of fluoride divided by area of the enamel cores. Data analysis was based on corrected data.
